questions.question: What is the primary purpose of channel equalisation in wireless communication?

answers.a: Reduce noise levels in the received signal.
answers.b: Reverse or compensate for the effects of the wireless channel on the signal.

explanations.a: Incorrect – equalisation primarily deals with channel distortions, not just noise.
explanations.b: Correct – the goal is to reverse the channel's distortion effects.
explanations.c: Incorrect – equalisation does not affect transmit power.
explanations.d: Incorrect – it does not increase bandwidth.

questions.question: The Zero Forcing (ZF) equalizer aims to:

explanations.a: Incorrect – ZF does not focus on noise minimization.
explanations.b: Incorrect – ZF can degrade SNR due to noise amplification.
explanations.c: Correct – ZF attempts to nullify inter-stream interference entirely.
explanations.d: Incorrect – matching the channel is the role of a matched filter.

questions.question: How does MMSE equalization differ from ZF equalization in terms of noise handling?

answers.a: MMSE minimizes mean square error but increases noise.
answers.b: MMSE minimizes mean square error while balancing noise and ISI.
answers.d: MMSE amplifies noise as channel gain approaches zero.

explanations.a: Incorrect – MMSE balances noise and ISI instead of just minimizing error at the cost of noise.
explanations.b: Correct – MMSE trades off between removing interference and avoiding noise amplification.
explanations.c: Incorrect – no equalizer can completely remove noise.
explanations.d: Incorrect – this describes ZF behaviour, not MMSE.

questions.question: Which of the following equalizers considers noise power explicitly?

explanations.b: Incorrect – matched filters do not explicitly account for noise power.
explanations.c: Correct – MMSE incorporates noise variance into its optimization.
explanations.d: Incorrect – DFE reduces ISI but does not directly factor noise into its design.

questions.question: Which equalization method typically has better Bit Error Rate (BER) performance at low SNR levels?

explanations.a: Incorrect – ZF suffers more at low SNR due to noise amplification.
explanations.b: Correct – MMSE handles noise better at low SNR.
explanations.c: Incorrect – they differ significantly at low SNR.
explanations.d: Incorrect – MMSE is better in this scenario.
